Drugs that activate this pathway will provide a novel strategy to promote the clearance of damaged mitochondria in Parkinson's disease.
Results showed that SIAH1 and PTP4A1 expression was regulated by mir-944 in breast cancer cells. miR-944 binds directly the 3 UTR of their promotor region.
Siah-1 expression was observed in 41.4% of oral squamous cell carcinoma. Siah-1 was expressed in the cytoplasm and cell membranes, and partially in the nucleus .
The crystallographic models provide structural insights into the substrate binding of the SIAH family E3 ubiquitin ligases that are critically involved in regulating cancer-related pathways.

Results suggest that activated STAT3 regulates active beta-catenin protein levels via stabilization of SIAH-1 and the subsequent ubiquitin-dependent proteasomal degradation of beta-catenin in HEK293T cells.

Study identified SIAH1/2 (SIAH) as the E3 ligase mediating Wnt-induced Axin degradation. SIAH proteins promote the ubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of Axin through interacting with a VxP motif in the GSK3-binding domain of Axin, and this function of SIAH is counteracted by GSK3 binding to Axin.

Depletion of KDM3A coincided with the loss of SIAH1 induction and the accumulation of dimethylated H3K9 surrounding the SIAH1 promoter. Interestingly, KDM3A expression was also up-regulated by nutritional stress in a HIF-1alpha dependent manner.

Results show that abolishing ICP0:SIAH-1 interaction affects the HSV-2 phenotype during infection. In vitro, the SIAH-binding deficient mutant synthesized significantly less DNA and protein, and virus growth was clearly attenuated compared to wild-type virus. In model mice, HSV-2 carrying the SIAH-binding deficient mutation caused an acute infection in the murine eye and was able to spread to the innervating neurons.

SIAH1 promotes senescence and apoptosis of nucleus pulposus cells to exacerbate disc degeneration through ubiquitinating XIAP.

Siah1 promotes the proliferation of NSCLC cells through ubiquitinating and stabilizing Notch1.

BP.term: positive regulation of intrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway

name: siah E3 ubiquitin protein ligase 1

reactome.name: Class I MHC mediated antigen processing & presentation

wikipathways.name: miRNA regulation of p53 pathway in prostate cancer

summary: This gene encodes a protein that is a member of the seven in absentia homolog (SIAH) family. The protein is an E3 ligase and is involved in ubiquitination and proteasome-mediated degradation of specific proteins. The activity of this ubiquitin ligase has been implicated in the development of certain forms of Parkinson's disease, the regulation of the cellular response to hypoxia and induction of apoptosis. Alternative splicing results in several additional transcript variants, some encoding different isoforms and others that have not been fully characterized. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
